  • Method Details

    • format

      public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String format)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted.

      Built-in Formats:
      ew("something"): appends "something" to data
      rw("this":"that"): replaces all of the instances of "this" in data with "that"
      bw("anything"): prepends "anything" to the beginning of data
      sc(): sets data to all caps
      sl(): sets data to all lowercase
      sb(someNumber:someSequence): at every given index someNumber, someSequence will be inserted in data

      Note: the code runs significantly faster if the format variable omits any unnecessary whitespace (i.e, inbetween formats)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • format

      public abstract java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String format, java.lang.Void personal)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted. Draws from a list constructed by the user.
      personal - a null variable that differentiates the signature from format(String data, String format)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • extrapolate

      public java.lang.String extrapolate​(java.lang.String source, java.lang.String function)
      Parameters:
      function - the specific function it is looking for in source, the list of functions
      source - the String that holds all of the functions to be used on data
      Returns:
      the data inside of the requested function from the source
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getLastCall

      public java.lang.String getLastCall()

    • getFormats

      public java.lang.String[] getFormats()
      Returns:
      every format inside of the ArrayList Formats
      Since:
      1.0.0
